intro: Aciotis purpurascens var. martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as coastal areas and disturbed soils. It has small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
